intro: Gnaphalium microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, linear leaves and produces fluffy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as heathlands and sand dunes. Gnaphalium microphyllum is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
